meanings.definition: To spread or daub (a substance) thinly or unevenly over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She smeared the paint on the canvas with her fingers.
meanings.sent2: The child smeared the frosting on the cake with excitement.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally smeared the mud on his face while playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The artist's emotions were smeared across the painting.
meanings.sent5: The butter smeared smoothly on the warm toast.

meanings.definition: To damage the reputation of (someone) by false accusations; slander.
meanings.sent1: The rival tried to smear her opponent's name before the competition.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid newspaper smeared the celebrity with untrue stories.
meanings.sent3: The jealous classmate tried to smear her friend's good reputation.
meanings.sent4: The politician's opponents attempted to smear his character during the election.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest journalist smeared the company's CEO in the article.

meanings.sent1: The ink on the paper smeared when it got wet.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the painting smeared together in the rain.
meanings.sent3: His glasses were so dirty that everything looked smeared to him.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day smeared in his mind over time.
meanings.sent5: The words on the old sign were smeared and hard to read.
